testimony.name: Darrick Borowski
key_points: Current zoning code from 1961 has contributed to the housing crisis
Changing codes is necessary to create affordable housing for all incomes
Supports proposals in the plan such as bonuses for affordability, housing over retail, legalizing shared living, small apartments, ADUs, and eliminating parking requirements
Housing affordability is crucial for maintaining New York City's vitality and cultural diversity
Many New Yorkers, including young professionals and creatives, are struggling to afford housing
Acknowledges concerns about increased density but believes prioritizing housing creation is necessary
Urges commissioners to vote yes for City of Yes for Housing Opportunity

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: In this draft, I see proposals that enable many of the possibilities my colleagues students and IFCS tools to help us get get us out of this current crisis, including bonuses for affordability
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker mentions 'bonuses for affordability' which aligns with the Universal Affordability Preference (UAP) element of the proposal that allows buildings to add more housing if it's affordable.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: In this draft, I see proposals that enable many of the possibilities my colleagues students and IFCS tools to help us get get us out of this current crisis, including [...] legalizing shared living, small apartments
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker mentions 'legalizing shared living, small apartments' which aligns with the Residential Conversions element of the proposal that allows for converting non-residential spaces into various types of housing, including shared housing.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: In this draft, I see proposals that enable many of the possibilities my colleagues students and IFCS tools to help us get get us out of this current crisis, including [...] housing over retail in town centers
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker directly mentions 'housing over retail in town centers' which is a key aspect of the Town Center Zoning element of the proposal.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: In this draft, I see proposals that enable many of the possibilities my colleagues students and IFCS tools to help us get get us out of this current crisis, including [...] eliminating parking requirements
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker directly mentions 'eliminating parking requirements' which aligns with the Removing Parking Mandates element of the proposal.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: In this draft, I see proposals that enable many of the possibilities my colleagues students and IFCS tools to help us get get us out of this current crisis, including [...] ADUs
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker directly mentions 'ADUs' which stands for Accessory Dwelling Units, a key element of the proposal.
